item.title: Marianne add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Any writer worth his salt writes to please himself...It's a self-exploratory operation that is endless. An exorcism of not necessarily his demon, but of his divine discontent." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "One always has a better book in one's mind than one can manage to get onto paper." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Marianne add a quote by George Mac Donald
item.description: "Work is not always required. There is such a thing as sacred idleness." -- George Mac Donald

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Marianne add a quote by Tagore
item.description: "I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy." -- Tagore
